General Layer Functions: The GameMaker Studio 2 Room Editor permits you to add layers of different assets to your room. These can be tile maps (using tile sets), backgrounds, sprites or sequences, and instances, but note that unlike the room editor, you are not limited to a single asset type per layer, and can add multiple asset types to the same layer - for example you can have a background and a tile map all on the same layer. Note that each asset that is added to a layer is considered an element of that layer.
